036package org.jfree.chart.internal;
037
038import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleAnchor;
039
040import java.awt.*;
041import java.awt.geom.*;
042import java.util.Arrays;
043import java.util.HashMap;
044import java.util.Map;
045import java.util.Objects;
046
047/**
048 * Utility methods for {@link Shape} objects.
049 */
050public class ShapeUtils {
051
052    /**
053     * Prevents instantiation.
054     */
055    private ShapeUtils() {
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Tests two shapes for equality.  If both shapes are {@code null},
060     * this method will return {@code true}.
061     * <p>
062     * In the current implementation, the following shapes are supported:
063     * {@code Ellipse2D}, {@code Line2D} and {@code Rectangle2D}
064     * (implicit).
065     *
066     * @param s1  the first shape ({@code null} permitted).
067     * @param s2  the second shape ({@code null} permitted).
068     *
069     * @return A boolean.
070     */
071    public static boolean equal(Shape s1, Shape s2) {
072        if (s1 instanceof Line2D && s2 instanceof Line2D) {
073            return equal((Line2D) s1, (Line2D) s2);
074        } else if (s1 instanceof Polygon && s2 instanceof Polygon) {
075            return equal((Polygon) s1, (Polygon) s2);
076        } else if (s1 instanceof Path2D && s2 instanceof Path2D) {
077            return equal((Path2D) s1, (Path2D) s2);
078        } else {
079            // this will handle Arc2D, Ellipse2D, Rectangle2D...
080            return Objects.equals(s1, s2);
081        }
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Compares two lines and returns {@code true} if they are equal or
086     * both {@code null}.
087     *
088     * @param l1  the first line ({@code null} permitted).
089     * @param l2  the second line ({@code null} permitted).
090     *
091     * @return A boolean.
092     */
093    public static boolean equal(Line2D l1, Line2D l2) {
094        if (l1 == null) {
095            return (l2 == null);
096        }
097        if (l2 == null) {
098            return false;
099        }
100        if (!l1.getP1().equals(l2.getP1())) {
101            return false;
102        }
103        if (!l1.getP2().equals(l2.getP2())) {
104            return false;
105        }
106        return true;
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Tests two polygons for equality.  If both are {@code null} this
111     * method returns {@code true}.
112     *
113     * @param p1  polygon 1 ({@code null} permitted).
114     * @param p2  polygon 2 ({@code null} permitted).
115     *
116     * @return A boolean.
117     */
118    public static boolean equal(Polygon p1, Polygon p2) {
119        if (p1 == null) {
120            return (p2 == null);
121        }
122        if (p2 == null) {
123            return false;
124        }
125        if (p1.npoints != p2.npoints) {
126            return false;
127        }
128        if (!Arrays.equals(p1.xpoints, p2.xpoints)) {
129            return false;
130        }
131        if (!Arrays.equals(p1.ypoints, p2.ypoints)) {
132            return false;
133        }
134        return true;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Tests two {@code GeneralPath} instances for equality.  If both are 
139     * {@code null} this method returns {@code true}.
140     *
141     * @param p1  path 1 ({@code null} permitted).
142     * @param p2  path 2 ({@code null} permitted).
143     *
144     * @return A boolean.
145     */
146    public static boolean equal(Path2D p1, Path2D p2) {
147        if (p1 == null) {
148            return (p2 == null);
149        }
150        if (p2 == null) {
151            return false;
152        }
153        if (p1.getWindingRule() != p2.getWindingRule()) {
154            return false;
155        }
156        PathIterator iterator1 = p1.getPathIterator(null);
157        PathIterator iterator2 = p2.getPathIterator(null);
158        double[] d1 = new double[6];
159        double[] d2 = new double[6];
160        boolean done = iterator1.isDone() && iterator2.isDone();
161        while (!done) {
162            if (iterator1.isDone() != iterator2.isDone()) {
163                return false;
164            }
165            int seg1 = iterator1.currentSegment(d1);
166            int seg2 = iterator2.currentSegment(d2);
167            if (seg1 != seg2) {
168                return false;
169            }
170            if (!Arrays.equals(d1, d2)) {
171                return false;
172            }
173            iterator1.next();
174            iterator2.next();
175            done = iterator1.isDone() && iterator2.isDone();
176        }
177        return true;
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Creates and returns a translated shape.
182     *
183     * @param shape  the shape ({@code null} not permitted).
184     * @param transX  the x translation (in Java2D space).
185     * @param transY  the y translation (in Java2D space).
186     *
187     * @return The translated shape.
188     */
189    public static Shape createTranslatedShape(Shape shape, double transX,
190            double transY) {
191        Args.nullNotPermitted(shape, "shape");
192        final AffineTransform transform = AffineTransform.getTranslateInstance(
193                transX, transY);
194        return transform.createTransformedShape(shape);
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Translates a shape to a new location such that the anchor point
199     * (relative to the rectangular bounds of the shape) aligns with the
200     * specified (x, y) coordinate in Java2D space.
201     *
202     * @param shape  the shape ({@code null} not permitted).
203     * @param anchor  the anchor ({@code null} not permitted).
204     * @param locationX  the x-coordinate (in Java2D space).
205     * @param locationY  the y-coordinate (in Java2D space).
206     *
207     * @return A new and translated shape.
208     */
209    public static Shape createTranslatedShape(Shape shape, 
210            RectangleAnchor anchor, double locationX, double locationY) {
211        Args.nullNotPermitted(shape, "shape");
212        Args.nullNotPermitted(anchor, "anchor");
213        Point2D anchorPoint = anchor.getAnchorPoint(shape.getBounds2D());
214        final AffineTransform transform = AffineTransform.getTranslateInstance(
215                locationX - anchorPoint.getX(), locationY - anchorPoint.getY());
216        return transform.createTransformedShape(shape);
217    }
218
219    /**
220     * Rotates a shape about the specified coordinates.
221     *
222     * @param base  the shape ({@code null} permitted, returns {@code null}).
223     * @param angle  the angle (in radians).
224     * @param x  the x coordinate for the rotation point (in Java2D space).
225     * @param y  the y coordinate for the rotation point (in Java2D space).
226     *
227     * @return the rotated shape.
228     */
229    public static Shape rotateShape(Shape base, double angle, float x, float y) {
230        if (base == null) {
231            return null;
232        }
233        AffineTransform rotate = AffineTransform.getRotateInstance(angle, x, y);
234        return rotate.createTransformedShape(base);
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Draws a shape with the specified rotation about {@code (x, y)}.
239     *
240     * @param g2  the graphics device ({@code null} not permitted).
241     * @param shape  the shape ({@code null} not permitted).
242     * @param angle  the angle (in radians).
243     * @param x  the x coordinate for the rotation point.
244     * @param y  the y coordinate for the rotation point.
245     */
246    public static void drawRotatedShape(Graphics2D g2, Shape shape, double angle,
247            float x, float y) {
248        Args.nullNotPermitted(g2, "g2");
249        Args.nullNotPermitted(shape, "shape");
250        AffineTransform saved = g2.getTransform();
251        AffineTransform rotate = AffineTransform.getRotateInstance(angle, x, y);
252        g2.transform(rotate);
253        g2.draw(shape);
254        g2.setTransform(saved);
255
256    }
257
258    /** A useful constant used internally. */
259    private static final float SQRT2 = (float) Math.pow(2.0, 0.5);
260
261    /**
262     * Creates a diagonal cross shape.
263     *
264     * @param l  the length of each 'arm'.
265     * @param t  the thickness.
266     *
267     * @return A diagonal cross shape.
268     */
269    public static Shape createDiagonalCross(float l, float t) {
270        final GeneralPath p0 = new GeneralPath();
271        p0.moveTo(-l - t, -l + t);
272        p0.lineTo(-l + t, -l - t);
273        p0.lineTo(0.0f, -t * SQRT2);
274        p0.lineTo(l - t, -l - t);
275        p0.lineTo(l + t, -l + t);
276        p0.lineTo(t * SQRT2, 0.0f);
277        p0.lineTo(l + t, l - t);
278        p0.lineTo(l - t, l + t);
279        p0.lineTo(0.0f, t * SQRT2);
280        p0.lineTo(-l + t, l + t);
281        p0.lineTo(-l - t, l - t);
282        p0.lineTo(-t * SQRT2, 0.0f);
283        p0.closePath();
284        return p0;
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * Creates a diagonal cross shape.
289     *
290     * @param l  the length of each 'arm'.
291     * @param t  the thickness.
292     *
293     * @return A diagonal cross shape.
294     */
295    public static Shape createRegularCross(float l, float t) {
296        final GeneralPath p0 = new GeneralPath();
297        p0.moveTo(-l, t);
298        p0.lineTo(-t, t);
299        p0.lineTo(-t, l);
300        p0.lineTo(t, l);
301        p0.lineTo(t, t);
302        p0.lineTo(l, t);
303        p0.lineTo(l, -t);
304        p0.lineTo(t, -t);
305        p0.lineTo(t, -l);
306        p0.lineTo(-t, -l);
307        p0.lineTo(-t, -t);
308        p0.lineTo(-l, -t);
309        p0.closePath();
310        return p0;
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Creates a diamond shape.
315     *
316     * @param s  the size factor (equal to half the height of the diamond).
317     *
318     * @return A diamond shape.
319     */
320    public static Shape createDiamond(float s) {
321        final GeneralPath p0 = new GeneralPath();
322        p0.moveTo(0.0f, -s);
323        p0.lineTo(s, 0.0f);
324        p0.lineTo(0.0f, s);
325        p0.lineTo(-s, 0.0f);
326        p0.closePath();
327        return p0;
328    }
329
330    /**
331     * Creates a triangle shape that points upwards.
332     *
333     * @param s  the size factor (equal to half the height of the triangle).
334     *
335     * @return A triangle shape.
336     */
337    public static Shape createUpTriangle(float s) {
338        final GeneralPath p0 = new GeneralPath();
339        p0.moveTo(0.0f, -s);
340        p0.lineTo(s, s);
341        p0.lineTo(-s, s);
342        p0.closePath();
343        return p0;
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * Creates a triangle shape that points downwards.
348     *
349     * @param s  the size factor (equal to half the height of the triangle).
350     *
351     * @return A triangle shape.
352     */
353    public static Shape createDownTriangle(float s) {
354        final GeneralPath p0 = new GeneralPath();
355        p0.moveTo(0.0f, s);
356        p0.lineTo(s, -s);
357        p0.lineTo(-s, -s);
358        p0.closePath();
359        return p0;
360    }
361
362    /**
363     * Creates a region surrounding a line segment by 'widening' the line
364     * segment.  A typical use for this method is the creation of a
365     * 'clickable' region for a line that is displayed on-screen.
366     *
367     * @param line  the line ({@code null} not permitted).
368     * @param width  the width of the region.
369     *
370     * @return A region that surrounds the line.
371     */
372    public static Shape createLineRegion(Line2D line, float width) {
373        Args.nullNotPermitted(line, "line");
374        final GeneralPath result = new GeneralPath();
375        final float x1 = (float) line.getX1();
376        final float x2 = (float) line.getX2();
377        final float y1 = (float) line.getY1();
378        final float y2 = (float) line.getY2();
379        if ((x2 - x1) != 0.0) {
380            final double theta = Math.atan((y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1));
381            final float dx = (float) Math.sin(theta) * width;
382            final float dy = (float) Math.cos(theta) * width;
383            result.moveTo(x1 - dx, y1 + dy);
384            result.lineTo(x1 + dx, y1 - dy);
385            result.lineTo(x2 + dx, y2 - dy);
386            result.lineTo(x2 - dx, y2 + dy);
387            result.closePath();
388        } else {
389            // special case, vertical line
390            result.moveTo(x1 - width / 2.0f, y1);
391            result.lineTo(x1 + width / 2.0f, y1);
392            result.lineTo(x2 + width / 2.0f, y2);
393            result.lineTo(x2 - width / 2.0f, y2);
394            result.closePath();
395        }
396        return result;
397    }
398
399    /**
400     * Returns a point based on (x, y) but constrained to be within the bounds
401     * of a given rectangle.
402     *
403     * @param x  the x-coordinate.
404     * @param y  the y-coordinate.
405     * @param area  the constraining rectangle ({@code null} not permitted).
406     *
407     * @return A point within the rectangle.
408     *
409     * @throws NullPointerException if {@code area} is {@code null}.
410     */
411    public static Point2D getPointInRectangle(double x, double y,
412            Rectangle2D area) {
413        x = Math.max(area.getMinX(), Math.min(x, area.getMaxX()));
414        y = Math.max(area.getMinY(), Math.min(y, area.getMaxY()));
415        return new Point2D.Double(x, y);
416    }
417
418    /**
419     * Checks, whether the given rectangle1 fully contains rectangle 2
420     * (even if rectangle 2 has a height or width of zero!).
421     *
422     * @param rect1  the first rectangle ({@code null} not permitted).
423     * @param rect2  the second rectangle ({@code null} not permitted).
424     *
425     * @return A boolean.
426     */
427    public static boolean contains(Rectangle2D rect1, Rectangle2D rect2) {
428        Args.nullNotPermitted(rect1, "rect1");
429        Args.nullNotPermitted(rect2, "rect2");
430        final double x0 = rect1.getX();
431        final double y0 = rect1.getY();
432        final double x = rect2.getX();
433        final double y = rect2.getY();
434        final double w = rect2.getWidth();
435        final double h = rect2.getHeight();
436        return ((x >= x0) && (y >= y0)
437                && ((x + w) <= (x0 + rect1.getWidth()))
438                && ((y + h) <= (y0 + rect1.getHeight())));
439    }
440
441    /**
442     * Checks, whether the given rectangle1 fully contains rectangle 2
443     * (even if rectangle 2 has a height or width of zero!).
444     *
445     * @param rect1  the first rectangle.
446     * @param rect2  the second rectangle.
447     *
448     * @return A boolean.
449     */
450    public static boolean intersects(Rectangle2D rect1, Rectangle2D rect2) {
451        Args.nullNotPermitted(rect1, "rect1");
452        Args.nullNotPermitted(rect2, "rect2");
453        final double x0 = rect1.getX();
454        final double y0 = rect1.getY();
455
456        final double x = rect2.getX();
457        final double width = rect2.getWidth();
458        final double y = rect2.getY();
459        final double height = rect2.getHeight();
460        return (x + width >= x0 && y + height >= y0 && x <= x0 + rect1.getWidth()
461              && y <= y0 + rect1.getHeight());
462    }
463    
464    /**
465     * Returns {@code true} if the specified point (x, y) falls within or
466     * on the boundary of the specified rectangle.
467     *
468     * @param rect  the rectangle ({@code null} not permitted).
469     * @param x  the x-coordinate.
470     * @param y  the y-coordinate.
471     *
472     * @return A boolean.
473     */
474    public static boolean isPointInRect(Rectangle2D rect, double x, double y) {
475        return (x >= rect.getMinX() && x <= rect.getMaxX()
476                && y >= rect.getMinY() && y <= rect.getMaxY());
477    }
478    
479    /**
480     * Clones a map containing shapes.
481     * 
482     * @param source  the source map.
483     * 
484     * @return A new map containing cloned shapes.
485     */
486    public static <K extends Comparable<K>> Map<K, Shape> cloneMap(Map<K, Shape> source) {
487        Map<K, Shape> result = new HashMap<>();
488        for (K key : source.keySet()) {
489            result.put(key, source.get(key));
490        }
491        return result;
492    }
493    
494    /**
495     * Returns {@code true} if the two maps contain the same set of entries and 
496     * {@code false} otherwise.
497     * 
498     * @param <K>  the key type.
499     * @param map1  the first map.
500     * @param map2  the second map.
501     * 
502     * @return A boolean.
503     */
504    public static <K extends Comparable<K>> boolean equal(Map<K, Shape> map1, Map<K, Shape> map2) {
505        if (!map1.keySet().equals(map2.keySet())) {
506            return false;
507        }
508        for (K key : map1.keySet()) {
509            Shape p1 = map1.get(key);
510            Shape p2 = map2.get(key);
511            if (!ShapeUtils.equal(p1, p2)) {
512                return false;
513            }
514        }
515        return true;
516    }
517 
518}
519
